1.content:
The Tyla Daycare has three rooms, for different stages of development.

Which one will we follow?

Room 1: The Caterpillar Room

For infants, from 3-12 months. Here, babies are learning to explore their world and move-so we test Wrigglers Stretch, to help them move and go. We also test the thick wipes, as babies's changing diets mean hard to clean diaper messes.

Room 2: The Cocoon Room

For young toddlers-about 12 months to 24 months, or two year olds. With children getting their feet, it's no wonder that here we test Wrigglers Slide-Ons, for squirmy toddlers. We also test on-the-go wipes in easy to carry packages-Thicky-Gos, Sensative-Gos, and Clean-Gos.

Room 3: The Butterfly Room

For older toddlers. It's sort of split in half-the half that's testing the bigger sizes of Streches and Slide-Ons, and other young toddler products, and the potty trainers, who are testing our Rovers Trainers, our Flushies, and bathroom products like Super Soap and Handy Clean.
1.title: Starting Off

11.content: Alright, who are we following?
11.title: Caterpillar Room.

112.content: Who do we follow, then?
112.title: One of the babies.

1123.content: What diaper is Juniper wearing and testing?
1123.title: Juniper, age 9 months

1124.content: Who do we follow, then?
1124.title: Someone else!

12.content: Alright, are we following an adult or a kid?
12.title: Cocoon Room.

13.content: Alright, and are we following one of the testers and caretakers, or one of the kids?
13.title: Butterfly Room.

132.content: Alright, who are we following?
132.title: Kids.

1321.content: What product is Chris helping test?
1321.title: Chris, age 4 years old

choices: Growing cold (if wet) or hot (if messy)
13211.content: These trainers are meant to help the wearer gain night time control. Whenever they sense urine or feces, they awaken the child by...
13211.title: Rovers Night Trainers.

choices: ...in the middle of the naptime, because his Trainer is cold.
...in the middle of naptime, because his Trainer is hot.
..in them middle of naptime, because he has to go, no accident!
...at the end of naptime, wet. They didn't work.
132111.content:
Just like the normal Rovers Trainers, the Night Trainers get cold or hot if wet or soiled.

Chris, who wears undies during the day, wears these to naps and bedtime. We see him waking up from a nap...
132111.title: Growing cold (if wet) or hot (if messy)

choices: Slightly (Only a bit of poop, can still use potty)
1321112.content: Chris awakens during naptime, squirming. Thermal sensors indicate the heat of his Rovers has hightened. How hot is it?
1321112.title: ...in the middle of naptime, because his Traine...

13211121.content:
Chris, woken up from his warm privates, realizes that he pooped, and heads on over to the bathroom to go potty.

He makes it, and sits on the potty, pulling down his pants to poop. Once he's done, he goes...
13211121.title: Slightly (Only a bit of poop, can still use potty)

choices: Waking up without the alarm going off.
Waking up at the end of naptime dry.
Waking up because the alarm goes off.
132112.content:
Yes, via a special electronic sensor on the front of it, the diaper will vibrate when wet or messed, waking the child up so they can go to the bathroom

Chris, who is daytime trained, wears these at the daycare during naptimes, and at home. We see him at naptime in the Butterfly room...
132112.title: Alarm

choices: Not fully potty trained and ok with being there
1323.content: Did kayla wanna be there to start off with? After all sh is a big 5 year old and should be fully potty trained
1323.title: Kayla, age 5

1324.content: How about some of the other kids?
1324.title: Someone else.

13243.content: And what is Tina testing, hmm?
13243.title: Tina, 2 years old

132432.content:
Tina's a squirmy kid, which is why she's in Wrigglers Slide-Ons, the diaper pants that go on like underwear for standing changes.

As a consequence, she's also testing Clean-Gos wipes, which are portable for changes anywhere.

Where is Tina in the Butterfly room?
132432.title: Slide-Ons

info.brief_description: A daycare is run by a diaper company to test their products. Follow kids and scientists!
info.description: The Tyla corporation runs their own daycare, not only as a second way of generating revenue, but also to test and improve their products by seeing them in motion. Diapers, training pants, wipes, all are tested in the three different rooms of the daycare. Who will you join as you watch products get tested and improved?
